edu.neu.ccis.sms.config

Class ConfigurationLoader

  • java.lang.Object
    • edu.neu.ccis.sms.config.ConfigurationLoader

  • public class ConfigurationLoader
extends java.lang.Object
    Load customized terminology for an individual web application instance as CompositeConfiguration, in form of properties from configuration sources.

    Expects the path of root configuration xml in an environment variable EnvKeys.CONFIG_ROOT_XML_PATH_ENV_VAR.

    Composite configuration is used so that configuration sources of different types such as XMLConfiguration, Properties configuration can be used.
    Currently supported configurations are XML and PropertiesConfiguration, which are the most frequently used for specifying configuration properties. Other configurations can be used as well by adding similar file identifiers.

    Root configuration xml file is the file which contains path of the actual configuration files. This avoids cluttering of actual configuration files with names of other configuration files. In root configuration xml different files types are distinguished using different file identifiers as described above.

    Configuration files can have any structure, as long as they have all the attributes and elements specified in ConfigKeys This is required since these attributes are used to extract application specific terminology from configuration files.
    Note : For XML configuration the topmost root element is ignored, so make the element you want as the root, child member of a pseudo root element.
    Author:
    Swapnil Gupta

    • Method Detail

      • loadConfiguration

        public org.apache.commons.configuration.CompositeConfiguration loadConfiguration()
        Load application terminology from all the configuration files(s) for an individual application instance in a CompositeConfiguration.

        If any of the configuration file is not found halt program execution. This is critical since the application terminology within the configuration files is used to dynamically build an application specific user interface. Any missing terminology may lead to an inconsistent UI.
        Returns:
        composite configuration for an individual application instance

      • addAllConfigurationSources

        private void addAllConfigurationSources(org.apache.commons.configuration.CompositeConfiguration terminologyConfig)
                                 throws org.apache.commons.configuration.ConfigurationException
        Iteratively add configurations from all the configurations sources specified in the root configuration file.
        Parameters:
        terminologyConfig - CompositeConfiguration object containing all the configuration properties
        Throws:
        org.apache.commons.configuration.ConfigurationException - the configuration exception

      • addConfigurationSource

        private static void addConfigurationSource(java.lang.String configurationSourceType,
                          java.lang.String configSource,
                          org.apache.commons.configuration.CompositeConfiguration terminologyConfig)
                                    throws org.apache.commons.configuration.ConfigurationException
        Add all the configuration properties from a single configuration file, based on the file identifier of the configuration file. Currently supports XML and properties configuration files, which are the most prevalent file types used to provide configuration.

        New file types can be specified by adding separate file identifiers for new file types.
        Parameters:
        configurationSourceType - String Identifier for configuration source type, which is used to identify the type of configuration to load the given configuration source
        configSource - String Configuration source to be added to the terminology configuration for the entire application
        terminologyConfig - CompositeConfiguration terminology configuration for the entire application
        Throws:
        org.apache.commons.configuration.ConfigurationException

      • getConfigXMLPathFromEnvironemnt

        private java.lang.String getConfigXMLPathFromEnvironemnt()
        Get the path of the root configuration xml file for an individual application instance, from environment variable EnvKeys.CONFIG_ROOT_XML_PATH_ENV_VAR
        Returns:
        the configuration xml path for individual application instance
